timeline.body: Why are you using continueWithTask? do you want to proceed even if this task is cancelled?

timeline.author: vkryachko

replies.bodyText: so now I changed it to continueWith and I check both results against null. Am I not handling error cases correctly?
replies.author: JasonAHeron

replies.bodyText: I am actually not sure that null can be returned at all from those tasks, if an error happened getResult() will throw that error so I think it should be fine in terms of error handling.
replies.author: vkryachko

timeline.body: It looks like this method can happen in parallel with the above `getId()` any reason you are doing them sequentially?, i.e.  could you try doing `Tasks.whenAll(idTask, tokenTask).continueWith()`?

timeline.body:
None of the tasks will return null. Its on me for not adding the annotations on the APIs. I will update that on my end.

The Tasks would throw exceptions which you might want to handle based on completion state.

timeline.body: nit: call it fid or instanceId to differentiate from any other type of id used in FIAM. Idk if there is one, just think it would avoid any confusion.
